title: Keira Knightley and mum Sharman take a walk with newborn baby Delilah
text:
She has reportedly named her second child Delilah with husband James Righton.

And Keira Knightley looked happy and relaxed as she enjoyed a low-key stroll with her mother Sharman Macdonald, who lovingly pushed along her daughter's newborn.

Stepping out in rainy London, the actress, 34, looked casually chic in an oversized grey coat atop a stylish checked dress.

Outing: Keira Knightley looked happy and relaxed as she enjoyed a low-key stroll with her mother Sharman Macdonald, who lovingly pushed along her daughter's pram

Keira teamed the flowing number with a pair of black heeled boots, and added her to her low-key look with a pair of glasses.

Joining her was her mother Sharman, who went for a low-key look too in a brown coat and jeans.

She looked every inch the doting grandmother as she carted along the youngster in a pram.

Keira and her husband James confirmed that they had welcomed their second child on September 13 by taking the tot on a stroll in London.

Low-key: Stepping out in rainy London, the actress, 34, looked casually chic in an oversized grey coat atop a stylish checked dress

And the pair have reportedly named the child 'Delilah.'

According to the Mail On Sunday, rocker James was overheard telling friends all about the baby at a Hugo Boss yacht party on Thursday.

It comes after the couple announced that they were expecting again in May, when Keira debuted her bump at the Chanel J12 party in Paris.

Ahead of giving birth Keira was seen out and about in London last month with her prominent bump on display.

The couple married in France in May 2013 and welcomed their first child, daughter Edie, in 2015.

Casual: Keira added her to her low-key look with a pair of glasses

In January, Keira spoke about the challenges of motherhood and of juggling her career with caring for her daughter.

She told Balance magazine: 'I don’t think we give women enough credit for the physical and emotional marathon they go through when becoming a mother.

'I come from a place of amazing privilege. I have an incredible support system; I’ve been unbelievably lucky in my career; I can afford good childcare, and yet I still find it really f***ing difficult.'

She added: 'It’s OK to say that. It doesn’t mean I don’t love my kid, it’s just me admitting that the sleep deprivation, the hormonal changes, the shift in relationship with my partner, are all things that make me feel as if I’m failing on a daily basis. I have to remind myself that I haven’t failed, I’m just doing what I can do, but it’s not easy.'
description: Keira Knightley looked happy and relaxed as she enjoyed a low-key stroll with her mother Sharman Macdonald, who lovingly pushed along her daughter's newborn.
